doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF YEAR 2014 GULFWIDE EMISSIONS INVENTORY STUDY

MARS RECONNAISSANCE ORBITER MR0 WAS LAUNCHED IN 2005 ARRIVING MARS SEVEN MONTHS LATER FOLLOWED BY 6 MONTHS OF AERO BRAKING BEFORE BEGINNING ITS SCIENCE MISSION IN THE SEARCH FOR EVIDENCE THAT WATER PERSISTED ON THE SURFACE OF MARS FOR A LONG PERIOD OF TIME. ONE OF THE SCIENCE INVESTIGATIONS IS THE DETERMINATION OF MARS GRAVITY FIELD AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES. THE PRINCIPAL DATASET IS THE MICROWAVE TRACKING DATA OF MRO BY THE NASA DEEP SPACE NETWORK DSN IN CONJUNCTION WITH AUXILIARY DATASETS, SUCH AS THE MARS TOPOGRAPHY AND MARS IMAGING DTA BY MRO AND PREVIOUS MARS MISSIONS INCLUDING MARS ODYSSEY AND MARS GLOBAL SURVEYOR MGS. THE WORK OF THIS INVESTIGATION IS A CONTINUATION OF PREVIOUS WORK BY THE MRO GRAVITY TEAM UNDER THE PI'S LEADERSHIP.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL::IGF STANDARDIZATION AND QUERYING OF DATA QUALITY METRICS AND CHARACTERISTICS FOR ELECTRONIC HEALTH DATA
IGF::OT::IGF TITLE: SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT FOR GENOMIC DATA COMMONSPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: DECEMBER 1, 2016 THROUGH NOVEMBER 30, 2017
IGF::CL::IGF PATIENT CENTERED OUTCOMES RESEARCH TRUST ACTIVITIES

PLANETARY WAVES ARE HIGHLY IMPORTANT FOR THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERE. THEY PRODUCE SUBSTANTIAL HEAT AND MOMENTUM FLUXES THAT STRONGLY INFLUENCE ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE, CIRCULATION, AND THE ASSOCIATED WEATHER AND CLIMATE. IN ADDITION,THEY INFLUENCE THE TRANSPORT AND DISTRIBUTION OF WATER VAPOR, DUST AND OTHER TRACERS. OBSERVATIONS SHOW THAT LARGE-SCALE EDDIES IN THE 20 KM<Z<80 KM ALTITUDE RANGE ARE DOMINATED BY SMALL ZONAL WAVENUMBERS (K = 1 AND 2). THIS PROPOSAL WILL INVESTIGATE THE CHARACTERISTICS AND EFFECTS OF LARGE-SCALE PLANETARY WAVES WITH ZONAL WAVENUMBER K = 1 AND 2 IN THE MIDDLE ATMOSPHERE OF MARS. THESE WAVES INCLUDE MIGRATING AND NON-MIGRATING THERMAL TIDES, (QUASI-) STATIONARY WAVES AND EASTWARD / WESTWARD TRAVELING WAVES. WE WILL STUDY THEIR (A) MODE AND STRUCTURE, (B) SEASONALITY AND VARIABILITY, (C) PROPAGATION AND ENERGETICS, AND (D) INTERACTION AND EFFECT. WE WILL CONCENTRATE ON THE "DUST STORM SEASON" (LS = 180 - 360) SINCE THIS SEASON EXHIBITS THE LARGEST VARIABILITY. THIS STUDY WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING SCIENCE QUESTIONS. 1) WHAT CONTROLS / MODULATES ABRUPT / GRADUAL WAVE MODE TRANSITION? 2) WHAT IS THE NATURE OF TROPICAL - EXTRATROPICAL COUPLING? 3) WHAT ARE THE EFFECTS OF INTERACTIONS OF THESE WAVES WITH THE MEAN FLOW AND WITH EACH OTHER IN THE GENERALCIRCULATION? 4) HOW DO THEY CHANGE UNDER VARIOUS DUST SCENARIOS? THESE INTER-RELATED SCIENCE QUESTIONS ARE MOTIVATED BY NEW BEHAVIORS OF LARGE-SCALE WAVES REVEALED BY RECENT SPACECRAFT OBSERVATIONS. THEY ARE CRUCIAL FOR REVEALING THE PROPERTY AND ROLE OF LARGE-SCALE WAVES IN THE MIDDLE ATMOSPHERE OF MARS, AND WILL LEAD TO BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERIC GENERAL CIRCULATION. THE ANALYSES (A) - (D) WORK TOGETHER TO ADDRESS THE SCIENCE QUESTIONS 1)-4). THIS PROPOSAL ADVANCES THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERE BY ANSWERING FUNDAMENTAL SCIENCE QUESTIONS PROMPTED BY RECENT SPACECRAFT OBSERVATIONS. IT DOES NOT DIRECTLY ANALYZE MARS SPACECRAFT DATA. INSTEAD, IT SEEKS THE UNDERLYING MECHANISMS THOUGH ANALYSES OF SIMULATION RESULTS THAT EXHIBIT THE SAME QUALITATIVE BEHAVIOR AS THE DATA AND HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF AVAILABILITY OF THE FULL SET OF REGULAR GRIDDED VARIABLES. THIS PROPOSAL FITS THE SCOPE OF THE MARS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH PROGRAM, AND IS RELEVANT TO MARS SCIENTIFIC GOALS, OBJECTIVES, INVESTIGATIONS AND PRIORITIES AS SUMMARIZED BY MEPAG (2012) - GOAL II OBJECTIVE A.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THIS RESEARCH&DEVELOPMENT EFFORT IS TO LAUNCH CENTER FOR RESILIENCE STUDIES NETWORK (CRS-NET) TO DIRECTLY SUPPORT DHS IN INFORMING AND ADVANCING THE CAPACITY FOR LIFELINE INFRASTRUCTURES TO BE BETTER PREPARED FOR, TO RAPIDLY RECOVER FROM, AND TO ADAPT TO NATURAL AND MAN-MADE DISASTERS. CRS-NET WILL FORM AND LEAD A COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH TEAM OF EXPERTS AND PRACTITIONERS THAT WILL EXAMINE MAJOR DISASTERS WHEN THEY OCCUR, TO INCLUDE DIRECTLLY SUPPORTING DHS NPPD'S NEW INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT AND RECOVERY PROGRAM.

doc.ContractDescription: EP-W-11-003 - NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION MOD 0091: THIS IS AN ADMINISTRATIVE CHANGE NEEDED TO HELP CORRECT PAYMENT ISSUES UNDER THIS CONTRACT. THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO SHIFT FUNDS FROM OPTION PERIOD IV TO BRIDGE 1 OF THE CONTRACT. MOD 0090: APPROVE USE OF SUBCONTRACTOR. MOD 0089: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING TO BRIDGE CONTRACT 2. MOD 0088: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO: (1) OBLIGATE FUNDING TO BRIDGE CONTRACT 1 AND BRIDGE CONTRACT 2; AND (2) ADJUST FUNDING TOTALS IN BRIDGE CONTRACT 2. MOD 0087: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO SHIFT $20,000.00 IN FUNDING FROM BRIDGE CONTRACT 1 TO BRIDGE CONTRACT 2. MOD 0086: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO: EXECUTE A FIVE (5) MONTH BRIDGE CONTRACT EXTENSION TO EP-W-11-003, WHICH INCORPORATES THE CONTRACTOR'S PROPOSAL AND COST ESTIMATE DATED 10 AUGUST 2016; EXTEND THE CONTRACT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE FROM 10 SEPTEMBER 2016 TO 10 FEBRUARY 2017; ADD NEW LINE ITEM 0044 WITH THE FOLLOWING CEILING AMOUNTS, ESTIMATED COST CEILING $1,279,967.00, FIXED FEE CEILING $102,397.00, AND LEVEL OF EFFORT CEILING 10,260 HOURS; AND OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING TO LINE ITEM 0044 TOTALING $93,000.00. MOD 0085: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING TO THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD. MOD 0084: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO : (1) DEOBLIGATE FUNDING FROM OPTION PERIOD IV TO ACCOUNT FOR SCOPE REDUCTIONS TO WORK UNDER WORK ASSIGNMENT 4-111 AND 4-115; AND (2) OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL TO THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD. MOD 0083: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO: (1) OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING TO THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD/LINE ITEM 0043; (2) DEOBLIGATE FUNDING FROM OPTION PERIOD IV/LINE ITEM 0041 AND THE BRIDGE CONTRACT PERIOD/LINE ITEM 0043 FOR WORK THAT HAS BEEN STOPPED. MOD 0082: THIS BILATERAL MODIFICATION IS BEING ISSUED TO INCORPORATE INTO CONTRACT EP-W-11-003 THE TERMS OF THE CONFIDENTIAL SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT CONSISTING OF EIGHT (8) TYPED PAGES, WHICH WAS ENTERED INTO BY ABT ASSOCIATES INC, BY AND THROUGH ITS VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL, BRIAN ROEMER, AND THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, BY AND THROUGH ITS CONTRACTING OFFICERS SHEILA FAGAN, NATALIA FISHER-JACKSON, STEFAN MARTIYAN, GENINE MCELROY, CHRISTINE EDWARDS, AND NOELLE MILLS, EFFECTIVE (ENTER THE DATE OF THE LAST SIGNATURE ON THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT), AS SET FORTH ON PAGES 3 THROUGH 10 OF THIS MODIFICATION. PRIOR YEAR FUNDS BEING OBLIGATED TO FUND THE CONFIDENTIAL SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT WILL BE PAID FROM THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNTING LINE FROM OPTION PERIOD IV OF THE CONTRACT: 14-15-B-40DF-201B53X28-2505-1440SRE065-001 MOD 0081: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO EXECUTE A SIX (6) MONTH BRIDGE CONTRACT EXTENSION AND TO INCREASE THE OPTION PERIOD IV ESTIMATED COST CEILING BY $1,850,043.00 AND THE FIXED FEE CEILING BY $148,003.00. ADDITIONALLY, INCREMENTAL FUNDING IS OBLIGATED TO THE CONTRACT TOTALING $763,180.89 AND ADD THE FEDCONNECT CLAUSE.
